at.ac.oeaw.cemm.bsf.vcffilter.inheritance

Class Inheritance

  • java.lang.Object
    • at.ac.oeaw.cemm.bsf.vcffilter.inheritance.Inheritance

  • public class Inheritance
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements criteria for finding autosomal recessive, autosomal dominant, compound heterozygous, and X-linked variants. Inheritance.java 04 OCT 2016
    Since:
    1.0

    • Method Detail

      • recessive

        public static java.util.ArrayList<htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> recessive(int affectedHashIndex,
                                                                                          java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext>> affected,
                                                                                          java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext>> unaffected,
                                                                                          int mother,
                                                                                          int father)
        Returns the list of variants from the candidates list that are homozygous for a non-reference allele and identical in all affected individuals as well as absent in homozygous state from all unaffected individuals. When mother and father hash indices are defined, a genotype consistency test is performed and variants failing this test are excluded. The parameters mother and father indicate the index of the corresponding variants Hashtable in the unaffected list. Affected and unaffected lists of hashtables contain all variants that passed the initial filtering for affected and unaffected individuals, respectively. The affectedHashIndex indicates the affected individual whose variants are used for testing. The list of affected and unaffected individuals is expected to contain Hashtable<String, VariantContext> objects where VariantContext objects are stored using keys in the form "contig_start" e.g. "1_123456789" The list of unaffected individuals may be null.
        Parameters:
        affectedHashIndex - index of Hashtable holding variants of a given affected individual
        affected - list of Hashtables holding variants of affected individuals
        unaffected - list of Hashtables holding variants of unaffected individuals
        mother - index of Hashtable holding variants of mother
        father - index of Hashtable holding variants of father
        Returns:
        ArrayList<VariantContext>
        Since:
        1.0

      • recessive

        public static java.util.ArrayList<htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> recessive(java.util.ArrayList<htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> candidates,
                                                                                          java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext>> affected,
                                                                                          java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext>> unaffected,
                                                                                          int mother,
                                                                                          int father)
        Returns the list of variants from the candidates list that are homozygous for a non-reference allele and identical in all affected individuals as well as absent in homozygous state from all unaffected individuals. When mother and father hash indices are defined, a genotype consistency test is performed and variants failing this test are excluded. The parameters mother and father indicate the index of the corresponding variants Hashtable in the unaffected list. Affected and unaffected lists of hashtables contain all variants that passed the initial filtering for affected and unaffected individuals, respectively. The list of affected and unaffected individuals is expected to contain Hashtable<String, VariantContext> objects where VariantContext objects are stored using keys in the form "contig_start" e.g. "1_123456789" The list of unaffected individuals may be null.
        Parameters:
        candidates - list of candidate variants
        affected - list of Hashtables holding variants of affected individuals
        unaffected - list of Hashtables holding variants of unaffected individuals
        mother - index of Hashtable holding variants of mother
        father - index of Hashtable holding variants of father
        Returns:
        ArrayList<VariantContext>
        Since:
        1.0

      • testGenotypeConsistency

        public static java.util.ArrayList<htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> testGenotypeConsistency(java.util.ArrayList<htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> candidates,
                                                                                                        java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> mother,
                                                                                                        java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> father)
        Tests if a list of variant genotypes is consistent with the parent genotypes. Returns the list of variants where the consistency test succeeds. When either mother or father data are null, consistency is tested for one parent only. When both mother or father data are null, no test is performed and the candidates list is returned. If a parent Hashtable<String, VariantContext> does not contain the corresponding VariantContext object, homozygous reference genotype is assumed for that parent. The Hashtable<String, VariantContext> objects for mother and father are expected to store VariantContext objects using keys in the form "contig_start" e.g. "1_123456789"
        Parameters:
        candidates - candidate variants
        mother - Hashtable of mother variants
        father - Hashtable of mother variants
        Returns:
        ArrayList<VariantContext>
        Since:
        1.0

      • testGenotypeConsistency

        public static java.util.ArrayList<htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> testGenotypeConsistency(java.util.ArrayList<htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> candidates,
                                                                                                        Relationship relation)
        Tests if a list of variant genotypes is consistent with the parent genotypes. Returns the list of variants where the consistency test succeeds. When either mother or father data are null, consistency is tested for one parent only. When both mother or father data are null, no test is performed and the candidates list is returned. If a parent Hashtable<String, VariantContext> does not contain the corresponding VariantContext object, homozygous reference genotype is assumed for that parent. The Hashtable<String, VariantContext> objects for mother and father are expected to store VariantContext objects using keys in the form "contig_start" e.g. "1_123456789"
        Parameters:
        candidates - list of candidate variants
        relation - parent child relationsship between individuals
        Returns:
        ArrayList<VariantContext>
        Since:
        1.0

      • testGenotypeInConsistency

        public static java.util.ArrayList<htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> testGenotypeInConsistency(java.util.ArrayList<htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> candidates,
                                                                                                          Relationship relation)
        Tests if a list of variant genotypes is consistent with the parent genotypes. Returns the list of variants where the consistency test succeeds. When either mother or father data are null, consistency is tested for one parent only. When both mother or father data are null, no test is performed and the candidates list is returned. If a parent Hashtable<String, VariantContext> does not contain the corresponding VariantContext object, homozygous reference genotype is assumed for that parent. The Hashtable<String, VariantContext> objects for mother and father are expected to store VariantContext objects using keys in the form "contig_start" e.g. "1_123456789"
        Parameters:
        candidates - list of candidate variants
        relation - parent child relationsship between individuals
        Returns:
        ArrayList<VariantContext>
        Since:

      • genotypeIsConsistent

        public static boolean genotypeIsConsistent(htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext variantcontext,
                                           java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> mother,
                                           java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> father)
        Tests if a given genotype consistent with the parent genotypes. Returns true if one child allele is found in the mother genotype and the other child allele is found in the father genotype. False otherwise. If a parent Hashtable<String, VariantContext> does not contain the corresponding VariantContext object, homozygous reference genotype is assumed for that parent. The Hashtable<String, VariantContext> objects for mother and father are expected to store VariantContext objects using keys in the form "contig_start" e.g. "1_123456789"
        Parameters:
        variantcontext - variant to be tested
        mother - Hashtable of mother variants
        father - Hashtable of father variants
        Returns:
        boolean
        Since:
        1.0

      • genotypeIsConsistent

        public static boolean genotypeIsConsistent(htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext variantcontext,
                                           java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> parent)
        Tests if a given set of child alleles is consistent with the parent genotype. Returns false if both child alleles are different from the parent alleles. True otherwise. If a parent Hashtable<String, VariantContext> does not contain the corresponding VariantContext object, homozygous reference genotype is assumed for that parent. The Hashtable<String, VariantContext> objects for the parent is expected to store VariantContext objects using keys in the form "contig_start" e.g. "1_123456789"
        Parameters:
        variantcontext - variant to be tested
        parent - Hashtable of variants of parent
        Returns:
        boolean
        Since:
        1.0

      • denovo

        public static java.util.ArrayList<htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> denovo(java.util.ArrayList<htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext> child,
                                                                                       Relationship relation,
                                                                                       java.util.ArrayList<java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,htsjdk.variant.variantcontext.VariantContext>> unaffected)
        Tests for denovo variants. Child genotype must be inconsistent with parent genotypes and new variant genotype must be absent from unaffected individuals.
        Parameters:
        child - list of variants for child
        relation - Family relationship for affected child
        unaffected - hash of variants for unaffected individuals
        Returns:
        ArrayList<VariantContext>
        Since:
        1.0
